IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
ALEXANDER CITY DIVISION
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,)
Plaintiff/Respondent, )
)
v. ) CASE NO.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
)
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND, )
Defendant/Petitioner. )
RESPONSE TO PETITIONER/MOTHER’S MOTION TO APPOINT
GUARDIAN AD LITEM
COMES NOW your Plaintiff/Respondent, Christopher Blaine McGregor, and in
response to Petitioner’s Motion to Appoint Guardian Ad Litem avers the following:
1. Petitioner’s contention that it has become apparent that the minor children are in need of
counselors is without merit.
2. This Court has had an opportunity to interview the children, and the children are fully
capable of articulating any issues that they may have, whether it be in chamber or on the
witness stand.
3. If this Court is inclined to grant a Guardian Ad Litem, your Respondent requests that any
and all costs be the responsibility of the Petitioner, due to the fact that it is her request
and that the Respondent believes that the request is without merit.
WHEREFORE, PREMISES CONSIDERED, the Respondent respectfully request that the
Mother’s Motion for Guardian Ad Litem for the children be denied
/s/ Tom F. Young, Jr.
TOM F. YOUNG, JR. (YOU009)
Attorney for Respondent/Plaintiff
OF COUNSEL:
Mr. Tom F. Young, Jr., Esq.
MORRIS HAYNES LLP
131 Main Street (35010)

Alexander City, Alabama 35011
